intro: Gussonea stolzii, commonly known as the Stolzii's ghost flower, is a unique member of the Aizoaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a succulent plant characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in arid environments and is adapted to store water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its flowers are often short-lived, opening in the late afternoon and closing by evening. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in the botanical world.
